019
020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.naming;
021
022import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.TokenTypes;
023import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.CommonUtil;
024
025/**
026 * <p>
027 * Checks that type names conform to a specified pattern.
028 * </p>
029 * <ul>
030 * <li>
031 * Property {@code format} - Specifies valid identifiers. Default value is
032 * {@code "^[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$"}.
033 * </li>
034 * <li>
035 * Property {@code applyToPublic} - Controls whether to apply the check to public member.
036 * Default value is {@code true}.
037 * </li>
038 * <li>
039 * Property {@code applyToProtected} - Controls whether to apply the check to protected member.
040 * Default value is {@code true}.
041 * </li>
042 * <li>
043 * Property {@code applyToPackage} - Controls whether to apply the check to package-private member.
044 * Default value is {@code true}.
045 * </li>
046 * <li>
047 * Property {@code applyToPrivate} - Controls whether to apply the check to private member.
048 * Default value is {@code true}.
049 * </li>
050 * <li>
051 * Property {@code tokens} - tokens to check Default value is:
052 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#CLASS_DEF">
053 * CLASS_DEF</a>,
054 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#INTERFACE_DEF">
055 * INTERFACE_DEF</a>,
056 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#ENUM_DEF">
057 * ENUM_DEF</a>,
058 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#ANNOTATION_DEF">
059 * ANNOTATION_DEF</a>.
060 * </li>
061 * </ul>
062 * <p>
063 * An example of how to configure the check is:
064 * </p>
065 * <pre>
066 * &lt;module name=&quot;TypeName&quot;/&gt;
067 * </pre>
068 * <p>Code Example:</p>
069 * <pre>
070 * public interface FirstName {} // OK
071 * protected class SecondName {} // OK
072 * enum Third_Name {} // violation, name 'Third_Name' must match pattern '^[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
073 * private class FourthName_ {} // violation, name 'FourthName_'
074 *                              // must match pattern '^[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
075 * </pre>
076 * <p>
077 * An example of how to configure the check for names that begin with
078 * a lower case letter, followed by letters, digits, and underscores.
079 * Also, suppress the check from being applied to protected and private type:
080 * </p>
081 * <pre>
082 * &lt;module name=&quot;TypeName&quot;&gt;
083 *   &lt;property name=&quot;format&quot; value=&quot;^[a-z](_?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$&quot;/&gt;
084 *   &lt;property name=&quot;applyToProtected&quot; value=&quot;false&quot;/&gt;
085 *   &lt;property name=&quot;applyToPrivate&quot; value=&quot;false&quot;/&gt;
086 * &lt;/module&gt;
087 * </pre>
088 * <p>Code Example:</p>
089 * <pre>
090 * public interface firstName {} // OK
091 * public class SecondName {} // violation, name 'SecondName'
092 *                            // must match pattern '^[a-z](_?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$'
093 * protected class ThirdName {} // OK
094 * private class FourthName {} // OK
095 * </pre>
096 * <p>
097 * The following configuration element ensures that interface names begin with {@code "I_"},
098 * followed by letters and digits:
099 * </p>
100 * <pre>
101 * &lt;module name=&quot;TypeName&quot;&gt;
102 *   &lt;property name=&quot;format&quot;
103 *     value=&quot;^I_[a-zA-Z0-9]*$&quot;/&gt;
104 *   &lt;property name=&quot;tokens&quot;
105 *     value=&quot;INTERFACE_DEF&quot;/&gt;
106 * &lt;/module&gt;
107 * </pre>
108 * <p>Code Example:</p>
109 * <pre>
110 * public interface I_firstName {} // OK
111 * interface SecondName {} // violation, name 'SecondName'
112 *                         // must match pattern '^I_[a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
113 * </pre>
114 *
115 * @since 3.0
116 */
117public class TypeNameCheck
118    extends AbstractAccessControlNameCheck {
119
120    /**
121     * Default pattern for type name.
122     */
123    public static final String DEFAULT_PATTERN = "^[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$";
124
125    /**
126     * Creates a new {@code TypeNameCheck} instance.
127     */
128    public TypeNameCheck() {
129        super(DEFAULT_PATTERN);
130    }
131
132    @Override
133    public int[] getDefaultTokens() {
134        return getAcceptableTokens();
135    }
136
137    @Override
138    public int[] getAcceptableTokens() {
139        return new int[] {TokenTypes.CLASS_DEF,
140                          TokenTypes.INTERFACE_DEF,
141                          TokenTypes.ENUM_DEF,
142                          TokenTypes.ANNOTATION_DEF,
143        };
144    }
145
146    @Override
147    public int[] getRequiredTokens() {
148        return CommonUtil.EMPTY_INT_ARRAY;
149    }
150
151}
